p: Over the past decades, arthropod-borne viral pathogens have re-emerged in South America, especially in middle and low-income countries [ 1â€“ 3]. In Peru, an increase of DENV and other arboviral infections have been observed in the last 5 years [ 7, 8]. However, only DENV, CHIKV and ZIKV are notifiable diseases in Peru, and less than 50% of samples can be confirmed by the Instituto Nacional de Salud, the only Laboratory in Peru designated for Epidemiological Surveillance [ 8, 24, 25]. This passive National surveillance strategy coupled with the diagnostic barriers in the rural areas have led to an underestimation of cases of arboviruses in the Peruvian Amazon Basin [ 1, 26].
